meanings.definition: To accustom (an infant or young mammal) to food other than its mother's milk.
meanings.sent1: The baby cow was weaned onto grass slowly by its farmer.
meanings.sent2: After a few weeks, the kitten was weaned off its mother's milk and started eating solid food.
meanings.sent3: The puppy thought it was weaned onto treats instead of milk, wagging its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: She weaned her child onto independence, letting them explore the world on their own.
meanings.sent5: The zookeeper weaned the baby elephant onto a diet of fruits and vegetables, ensuring its health and growth.

meanings.definition: To detach from a source of dependence or support.
meanings.sent1: The teenager weaned himself off video games and spent more time outdoors.
meanings.sent2: She slowly weaned herself off social media, feeling more present in the moment.
meanings.sent3: The plant was weaned off artificial light, thriving under the natural sunlight.
meanings.sent4: He weaned his cat off sleeping on his bed, teaching it to sleep in its own cozy spot.
meanings.sent5: The athlete weaned off energy drinks, focusing on healthier hydration options for better performance.
